description.narrative:
The total amount of remittances is much higher than the total amount of all official development aid worldwide. The flow of remittances tends as well to be more stable than other capital flows (Adams 2009, Giuliano & Ruiz-Arranz 2008, Moyo 2010, World Bank). There is no doubt that remittances have become tremendously important to the welfare of a large number of people and for the foreign exchange position of the receiving countries (Catrinescu 2009, Giuliano & Ruiz-Arranz 2008, Moyo 2010).
BASUG, a Netherlands-based Diaspora organisation registered with the Dutch Chamber of Commerce, emerged out of desire and conviction of a number of professional migrants in the Netherlands coming mainly from Bangladesh, and others here to work on issues relevant to the community and overwhelming urge to contribute to development of Bangladesh. BASUG’s strategy is to work in partnership with serious and credible organizations and individuals to further its stated goals.
From 2010 to 2012 BASUG and The Network University have engaged in research and awareness raising activities on Remittances for Community Development (RfCD). The partners have been able to determine challenges and opportunities to design inspiring RfCD initiatives. Drawing on their research data and building on inspiring experiences, they have as a result come to see great potential in the following approach: developing specific financing opportunities for remitters that meet the needs of local communities in the countries of origin. Consequently, the partners wish to explore the possible financing opportunities for remittances that exist or can be designed in collaboration with relevant stakeholders.
If the partners do not succeedto encourage IFAD, GIZ and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs to give financial support for further remittance project after April 2014, Oxfam Novib will no longer work on the theme of remittance and this financial support will be the last one to Oxfam Novib partners, especially to BASUG and TNU for their remittances initiatives.
Program: 1, OI: 17

participating-org.narrative: Basug was established in 2015. BASUG was launched through a day-long program in Rotterdam which was attended among others by the representatives from our partner organisations, Oxfam Novib (Piet Luyx) and ICCO and a good number of Bangladeshi diasporas, not only from the Netherlands, but also from the neighboring countries, such as, Belgium, Luxemburg, Germany and France. Apart from the mainstream Dutch community members, the program was also attended by the members from Bangladeshi, Surinamese and Indian migrants communities. During the last 10 years BASUG emerged as a professional Diaspora organisation, has been able to widen its network at nationaland international level and has drawn attention and appreciation from different quarters, both from the governments and the private. Basug has been working for the last 7 years with Oxfam Novib, mainly on the topic of Diaspora and their involvement for Bangladesh, to contribute on poverty reduction.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: no. of cases by nationally and globally operating partner organisations documenting examples of alternative economic models, together with knowledge institutes
